androidx.core.widget

Interface TintableImageSourceView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppCompatImageButton, AppCompatImageView

    public interface TintableImageSourceView
    Interface which allows an android.widget.ImageView to receive image tinting calls from ImageViewCompat when running on API v20 devices or lower.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ColorStateList getSupportImageTintList()
      Return the tint applied to the image drawable, if specified.
      PorterDuff.Mode getSupportImageTintMode()
      Return the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image drawable, if specified.
      void setSupportImageTintList(ColorStateList tint)
      Applies a tint to the image drawable.
      void setSupportImageTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
      Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by setSupportImageTintList(ColorStateList)} to the image drawable.

    • Method Detail

      • setSupportImageTintList

        void setSupportImageTintList(@Nullable
                             ColorStateList tint)
        Applies a tint to the image drawable. Does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN by default.

        Subsequent calls to the source's image will automatically mutate the drawable and apply the specified tint and tint mode.

        Parameters:
        tint - the tint to apply, may be null to clear tint
        See Also:
        getSupportImageTintList()

      • getSupportImageTintList

        @Nullable
ColorStateList getSupportImageTintList()
        Return the tint applied to the image drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        the tint applied to the image drawable

      • setSupportImageTintMode

        void setSupportImageTintMode(@Nullable
                             PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
        Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by setSupportImageTintList(ColorStateList)} to the image drawable. The default mode is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN.
        Parameters:
        tintMode - the blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear tint
        See Also:
        getSupportImageTintMode()

      • getSupportImageTintMode

        @Nullable
PorterDuff.Mode getSupportImageTintMode()
        Return the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image drawable

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
